author: Evan Eisenberg
title: ‘Lament From Epirus’ Review: Ode on a Grecian Yearn
text:
Imagine if the only keepsake you had of your beloved were the necklace with which she was strangled.
This, roughly, is how Christopher King feels about 78 rpm records. The music he loves—rural folk music rooted deeply in place, whether the Mississippi Delta or the peaks of northwestern Greece—was murdered, he alleges, by the homogenizing, commercializing, globalizing effect of records. Yet these same 78s are his only means of hearing the music in its authentic form, fixed for eternity in black amber.
...
